statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Devin Sibley scored 22 and Kris Acox 18 with 14 rebounds as Furman defeated Western Carolina 74-62 on Wednesday night, for its first 10-game winning streak in 37 years.
article.headline: Sibley, Acox combine for 40, Furman reaches 20 wins
article.linkText: Sibley, Acox combine for 40, Furman reaches 20 wins
article.story: CULLOWHEE, N.C. -- Devin Sibley scored 22 and Kris Acox 18 with 14 rebounds as Furman defeated Western Carolina 74-62 on Wednesday night, for its first 10-game winning streak in 37 years. Daniel Fowler scored 11 points for the Paladins (20-8, 13-2 Southern Conference), while Acox added four assists and four steals and John Davis had five assists, five rebounds and six points. The win also gives Furman its first 20-win season since 2010-11. With three games left, Furman maintains its 1 1/2-game lead on East Tennessee State (11-3), which eked out a 79-77 win on Wednesday. The two teams meet Feb. 22. The win was also Furman's fifth straight road win, its longest such streak since the 1930s. Devin Peterson scored 22 to lead Western Carolina (7-20, 2-12) which has now lost five straight. Marc Gosselin added 16 points and nine boards.
